sen.j: 藤原 清貫（ふじわら の きよつら、貞観_(日本)9年（867年）-延長 (元号)8年6月26日_(旧暦)（930年7月24日））は、平安時代の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kiyotsura (867 - July 24, 930) was a noble who lived in the Heian Period.
FUJIWARA no Kiyotsura (867 - July 24, 930) was a noble who lived in the Heian Period.
FUJIWARA no Kiyotsura (867 - July 29, 930) was a noble who lived in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、Heian periodとしました。

sen.j: 父は名地方官として知られた藤原南家の民部卿藤原保則、母は在原業平の娘とされているが、保則の父である藤原貞雄（右大臣藤原継縄の孫で藤原乙叡の子）を実父とする異説もある。
sen.e: it is said that his father was FUJIWARA no Yasunori, who was Minbukyo (minister of popular affairs), from the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan and his mother was a daughter of ARIWARA no Narihira, but there is another view in which his father was the father of Yasunori, FUJIARA no Sadao (FUJIWARA no Tsugutada's grandson and FUJIWARA no Tadatoshi's son) of FUJIWARA no Tsugutada).

sen.j: 醍醐天皇に仕えて藤原時平政権に参加、延喜式編纂や昌泰の変（菅原道真の追放）などに関わったとされる。
sen.e: He served the Emperor Daigo and took part in the FUJAWARA no Tokihira's government and, reportedly, he was involved in compilation of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) and Shotai no Hen (Incident of Shotai era)(purge of SUGAWARA no Michizane).

sen.cmt: Shotai no Hen (Incident of Shotai era)→the Shotai Incidentとしました。

sen.j: 宇佐八幡宮への使者に任じられた折には、道真を見舞うとして大宰府を訪れ、帰京後に道真の動向を天皇や時平に報告している。
sen.e: When he was appointed to an envoy to the Usa Hachiman-gu Shrine, he visited Dazaifu telling that he pay a sympathetic visit to Michizane and, after his return to Kyoto, he reported the Emperor and Tokihira the conditions of Michizane.

sen.j: 延長8年6月26日、正三位権大納言（民部卿・東宮傅兼務）であった清貫は宮中の清涼殿において落雷に遭遇する。
sen.e: On June 26, 930, Kiyotsura, who was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Gon Dainagon (concurrently, Minbukyo and Togu no Fu (Head Tutor of Crown Prince) was struck by lightning in Seiryoden (Emperor's private residence) in the Imperial Court.

On June 26, 930, Kiyotsura, who was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Gon Dainagon (concurrently, Minbukyo and Togu no Fu (Head Tutor of Crown Prince) were struck by lightning in Seiryoden (Emperor's private residence) in the Imperial Court.

On July 29, 930, Kiyotsura, who was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) (concurrently, Minbukyo and Togu no Fu (Head Tutor of Crown Prince)) were struck by lightning in Seiryoden (Emperor's private residence) in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: June 26, 930→旧暦のため、July 29, 930 (グレゴリオ暦)に修正、カッコの不足分を追加、Gon Dainagonの補足追加、余分なスペース消去

sen.j: 直撃を受けた清貫は衣服を焼損し胸を裂かれた状態で陽明門から自宅に搬出されたものの、即死状態であったという。
sen.e: Kiyotsura was struck directly and he was carried out to his own residence in a condition that his clothes were burnt and his chest was torn but he was and his death was almost instantaneous.
Kiyotsura was struck directly, dying instantly and carried out to his own residence with his clothes burnt and chest torn.

sen.j: 人々は清貫が菅原道真の追放に関与したために、その怨霊によって報いを受けたと噂したと言う。
sen.e: Reportedly, people rumored that, as Kiyotsura took part in purge of SUGAWARA no Michizane, he was revenged by the vengeful spirit.
